page.title: 15Housing In Bishop Monkton
page.content: The great majority of houses in the area are those in or near the village of Bishop Monkton,where the total number within the village boundaries is about 300.About two-thirds of these are brick or stone-built houses of various sizes mostly built before the 1939-45 war,many of which have now been extended or modernised.At the south-west extremity of the village there is a public housing estate of forty houses,most of which were built in 1965,and there are two estates of modern houses and bungalows,totalling about ninety in all,which were all built during the period 1975/6 by large firms of estate developers.No other large scale development has taken place or is expected,and the area is officially designated as a Conservation Area.
